summary: I am both a thinker and a doer. My goal is to improve healthcare through research. For this, I use my two strengths: thoroughly analysing complex questions, but also quickly getting to the heart of the matter, bringing focus in complicated subjects and communicating my conclusions to others to translate this into action. As science coordinator and researcher, projects have often involved policy development, strategical partnerships, complex stakeholder relationships, coordinating teams, fundraising, overall project management, strategic planning and teaching. My motto is: the challenge is in the moment.

profile_positions.description:
Sabbatical, including:
- volunteer work as a Dutch language coach for newcomers (Rode Kruis Eindhoven and Humanitas Eindhoven)
- career orientation 
- maternity leave
profile_positions.title: Sabbatical

profile_positions.description:
A combination of translational and fundamental research into rheumatoid diseases and cellular immunology, using systems medicine, bioinformatics and in vitro assays

Daily supervision of 2 PhD students and 2 research technicians working on projects regarding set-up of new in vitro assays, transcriptomics, miRNA profiling, epigenetics, dendritic cells, monocytes and macrophages.
